Show / Hide Table of Contents

Class AtomCategoryDocument

Represents a list of categories available to be used when categorizing web resources.

Inheritance
System.Object
AtomCategoryDocument
Implements
ISyndicationResource
IExtensibleSyndicationObject
IAtomCommonObjectAttributes
System.IComparable
Inherited Members
System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object)
System.Object.GetType()
System.Object.MemberwiseClone()
System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object)
Namespace: Argotic.Publishing
Assembly: Argotic.Core.dll
Syntax
[Serializable]
public class AtomCategoryDocument : ISyndicationResource, IExtensibleSyndicationObject, IAtomCommonObjectAttributes, IComparable
Remarks

The AtomCategoryDocument class implements the app:categories element of the Atom Publishing Protocol.

Category documents contain lists of categories described using the AtomCategory entity. Categories can also appear in AtomServiceDocument, where they indicate the categories allowed in a AtomMemberResources.

An AtomCategoryDocument can contain zero or more AtomCategory entities. Category documents are identified with the application/atomcat+xml media type.

BaseUri

Gets or sets the base URI other than the base URI of the document or external entity.

Declaration
public Uri BaseUri { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Uri

A Uri that represents a base URI other than the base URI of the document or external entity. The default value is a null reference.
Remarks

The value of this property is interpreted as a URI Reference as defined in RFC 2396: Uniform Resource Identifiers, after processing according to XML Base, Section 3.1 (URI Reference Encoding and Escaping).

| Improve this Doc View Source

Categories

Gets or sets the categories associated with this document.

Declaration
public IEnumerable<AtomCategory> Categories { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<AtomCategory>

A System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> collection of AtomCategory objects that represent categories associated with this document.
Remarks

This System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> collection of AtomCategory objects is internally represented as a System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<T> collection.

The Categories collection of a AtomCategoryDocument can contain zero or more AtomCategory objects.

A AtomCategory object that has no Scheme specified inherits the Scheme of its AtomCategoryDocument parent. A AtomCategory object with an existing Scheme specified does not inherit the Scheme of its AtomCategoryDocument parent.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
| Improve this Doc View Source

Scheme

Gets or sets an IRI that identifies the categorization scheme used by this document.

Declaration
public Uri Scheme { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Uri

A Uri that represents a Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI) that identifies the categorization scheme used by this document. The default value is a null reference, which indicates that no inheritable categorization scheme was specifed.
Remarks

See RFC 3987: Internationalized Resource Identifiers for the IRI technical specification.

See System.Uri for enabling support for IRIs within Microsoft .NET framework applications.

| Improve this Doc View Source

Uri

Gets or sets an IRI that identifies the location of this AtomCategoryDocument.

Declaration
public Uri Uri { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Uri

A Uri that represents a Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI) that identifies the location of this AtomCategoryDocument.
Remarks

If a Uri is specified, the Categories collection must be empty and must not specify a Scheme or indicate that it represents a IsFixed set of categories.

See RFC 3987: Internationalized Resource Identifiers for the IRI technical specification.

See System.Uri for enabling support for IRIs within Microsoft .NET framework applications.

CompareSequence(Collection<AtomCategoryDocument>, Collection<AtomCategoryDocument>)

Compares two specified System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<T> collections.

Declaration
public static int CompareSequence(Collection<AtomCategoryDocument> source, Collection<AtomCategoryDocument> target)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<AtomCategoryDocument> source

The first collection.
System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection<AtomCategoryDocument> target

The second collection.
Returns
Type Description
System.Int32

A 32-bit signed integer indicating the lexical relationship between the two comparands.
Remarks

If the collections contain the same number of elements, determines the lexical relationship between the two sequences of comparands.

If the source has an element count that is greater than the target element count, returns 1.

If the source has an element count that is less than the target element count, returns -1.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The source is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
System.ArgumentNullException

The target is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Returns
Type Description
System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator

A read-only System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator object.
Remarks

The System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator is positioned on the root element of the AtomCategoryDocument. If there is no root element, the System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator is positioned on the first element in the XML representation of the AtomCategoryDocument.

FindCategory(Predicate<AtomCategory>)

Searches for a category that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, and returns the first occurrence within the Categories collection.

Declaration
public AtomCategory FindCategory(Predicate<AtomCategory> match)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Predicate<AtomCategory> match

The System.Predicate<T> delegate that defines the conditions of the AtomCategory to search for.
Returns
Type Description
AtomCategory

The first category that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, if found; otherwise, the default value for AtomCategory.
Remarks

The System.Predicate<T> is a delegate to a method that returns true if the object passed to it matches the conditions defined in the delegate. The elements of the current Categories are individually passed to the System.Predicate<T> delegate, moving forward in the Categories, starting with the first element and ending with the last element. Processing is stopped when a match is found.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The match is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
| Improve this Doc View Source

FindExtension(Predicate<ISyndicationExtension>)

Searches for a syndication extension that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, and returns the first occurrence within the Extensions collection.

Declaration
public ISyndicationExtension FindExtension(Predicate<ISyndicationExtension> match)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Predicate<ISyndicationExtension> match

The System.Predicate<T> delegate that defines the conditions of the ISyndicationExtension to search for.
Returns
Type Description
ISyndicationExtension

The first syndication extension that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, if found; otherwise, the default value for ISyndicationExtension.
Remarks

The System.Predicate<T> is a delegate to a method that returns true if the object passed to it matches the conditions defined in the delegate. The elements of the current Extensions are individually passed to the System.Predicate<T> delegate, moving forward in the Extensions, starting with the first element and ending with the last element. Processing is stopped when a match is found.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The match is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

Load(Uri, WebRequestOptions, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings)

Loads the syndication resource from the supplied Uri using the specified System.Net.ICredentials, System.Net.IWebProxy and SyndicationResourceLoadSettings.

Declaration
public void Load(Uri source, WebRequestOptions options, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that points to the location of the web resource used to load the syndication resource.
WebRequestOptions options

A WebRequestOptions that holds options that should be applied to web requests.
SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings

The SyndicationResourceLoadSettings object used to configure the AtomCategoryDocument instance. This value can be null.
Remarks

  • If settings has a CharacterEncoding of System.Text.Encoding.UTF8 the character encoding of the source will be attempt to be determined automatically, otherwise the specified character encoding will be used. If automatic detection fails, a character encoding of System.Text.Encoding.UTF8 is used by default.
  • After the load operation has successfully completed, the Loaded event will be raised.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The source is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
System.FormatException

The source data does not conform to the expected syndication content format. In this case, the document remains empty.
System.Xml.XmlException

There is a load or parse error in the XML. In this case, the document remains empty.

Load(Uri, ICredentials, IWebProxy)

Loads the syndication resource from the supplied Uri using the specified System.Net.ICredentials and System.Net.IWebProxy.

Declaration
public void Load(Uri source, ICredentials credentials, IWebProxy proxy)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that points to the location of the web resource used to load the syndication resource.
System.Net.ICredentials credentials

A System.Net.ICredentials that provides the proper set of credentials to the source resource when required. This value can be null.
System.Net.IWebProxy proxy

A System.Net.IWebProxy that provides proxy access to the source resource when required. This value can be null.
Remarks

  • If credentials is null, request is made using the default application credentials.
  • If proxy is null, request is made using the System.Net.WebRequest default proxy settings.
  • After the load operation has successfully completed, the Loaded event will be raised.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The source is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
System.FormatException

The source data does not conform to the expected syndication content format. In this case, the document remains empty.
System.Xml.XmlException

There is a load or parse error in the XML. In this case, the document remains empty.

Load(Uri, ICredentials, IWebProxy, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings)

Loads the syndication resource from the supplied Uri using the specified System.Net.ICredentials, System.Net.IWebProxy and SyndicationResourceLoadSettings.

Declaration
public void Load(Uri source, ICredentials credentials, IWebProxy proxy, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that points to the location of the web resource used to load the syndication resource.
System.Net.ICredentials credentials

A System.Net.ICredentials that provides the proper set of credentials to the source resource when required. This value can be null.
System.Net.IWebProxy proxy

A System.Net.IWebProxy that provides proxy access to the source resource when required. This value can be null.
SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings

The SyndicationResourceLoadSettings object used to configure the AtomCategoryDocument instance. This value can be null.
Remarks

  • If credentials is null, request is made using the default application credentials.
  • If proxy is null, request is made using the System.Net.WebRequest default proxy settings.
  • If settings has a CharacterEncoding of System.Text.Encoding.UTF8 the character encoding of the source will be attempt to be determined automatically, otherwise the specified character encoding will be used. If automatic detection fails, a character encoding of System.Text.Encoding.UTF8 is used by default.
  • After the load operation has successfully completed, the Loaded event will be raised.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The source is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
System.FormatException

LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, WebRequestOptions, Object)

Loads this AtomCategoryDocument instance asynchronously using the specified Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, System.Net.ICredentials, and System.Net.IWebProxy.

Declaration
public void LoadAsync(Uri source, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings, WebRequestOptions options, object userToken)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that represents the URL of the syndication resource XML data.
SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings

The SyndicationResourceLoadSettings object used to configure the AtomCategoryDocument instance. This value can be null.
WebRequestOptions options

A WebRequestOptions that holds options that should be applied to web requests.
System.Object userToken

A user-defined object that is passed to the method invoked when the asynchronous operation completes.
Remarks

To receive notification when the operation has completed or the operation has been canceled, add an event handler to the Loaded event. You can cancel a LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object) operation by calling the LoadAsyncCancel() method.

After calling LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object), you must wait for the load operation to complete before attempting to load the syndication resource using the LoadAsync(Uri, Object) method.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The source is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
System.FormatException

The source data does not conform to the expected syndication content format. In this case, the document remains empty.
System.InvalidOperationException

This AtomCategoryDocument has a LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object) call in progress.
| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object)

Loads this AtomCategoryDocument instance asynchronously using the specified Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, System.Net.ICredentials, and System.Net.IWebProxy.

Declaration
public void LoadAsync(Uri source, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings, ICredentials credentials, IWebProxy proxy, object userToken)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that represents the URL of the syndication resource XML data.
SyndicationResourceLoadSettings settings

The SyndicationResourceLoadSettings object used to configure the AtomCategoryDocument instance. This value can be null.
System.Net.ICredentials credentials

A System.Net.ICredentials that provides the proper set of credentials to the source when required. This value can be null.
System.Net.IWebProxy proxy

A System.Net.IWebProxy that provides proxy access to the source when required. This value can be null.
System.Object userToken

A user-defined object that is passed to the method invoked when the asynchronous operation completes.
Remarks

To receive notification when the operation has completed or the operation has been canceled, add an event handler to the Loaded event. You can cancel a LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object) operation by calling the LoadAsyncCancel() method.

After calling LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object), you must wait for the load operation to complete before attempting to load the syndication resource using the LoadAsync(Uri, Object) method.

The source data does not conform to the expected syndication content format. In this case, the document remains empty.

Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Uri source

A Uri that represents the URL of the syndication resource XML data.

Remarks

The AtomCategoryDocument is loaded using the default SyndicationResourceLoadSettings.

To receive notification when the operation has completed or the operation has been canceled, add an event handler to the Loaded event. You can cancel a LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object) operation by calling the LoadAsyncCancel() method.

After calling LoadAsync(Uri, SyndicationResourceLoadSettings, ICredentials, IWebProxy, Object), you must wait for the load operation to complete before attempting to load the syndication resource using the LoadAsync(Uri, Object) method.

| Improve this Doc View Source

LoadAsyncCancel()

Cancels an asynchronous operation to load this syndication resource.

Declaration
public void LoadAsyncCancel()
Remarks

Use the LoadAsyncCancel method to cancel a pending LoadAsync(Uri, Object) operation. If there is a load operation in progress, this method releases resources used to execute the load operation. If there is no load operation pending, this method does nothing.
